fields.title: Colorist in Wartime
fields.abstract: An Iraqi painter and colorist who has been living in exile for 30 years in Rome, provides this portrait

fields.title: A Syrian Love Story
fields.abstract: Two political prisoners in pre-Arab Spring Syria end up falling in love and are forced from their home later, because of political shifts and a country lingering on the brink of civil war

fields.title: Rukan
fields.abstract: Comparing the image ISIS publicly portrays through propaganda with interviews of refugees, the filmmaker uses those stories to paint a bleak picture of life under their rule

fields.title: Lucio
fields.abstract: One man, in the 1970's, was able to take tens of millions of dollars from a bank using fake checks, all to help those who were suffering, including refugees

fields.title: The Suffering Grasses
fields.abstract: After the Arab Spring, Syria fell deep into a civil war that still rages on today, the refugees in the film are just a few of the millions who have suffered because of this conflict

fields.title: Returning Home: Revival of a Bosnian Village
fields.abstract: Internally displaced Bosniak and Croat refugees come to respect each other because of their commonality of being internally displaced even though some occupy other's houses

fields.title: Theatre & War
fields.abstract: Internally displaced refugees seeking refuge in a Beirut theatre, get a deep appreciation of the power of the arts

fields.title: The Invisible Man
fields.abstract: Illegal refugee immigrants who were persecuted for the sexual orientation by their families and the government have to face the sad reality of having to leave their homeland for safety in other countries

fields.title: Peace Effort in Vukovar
fields.abstract: Refugees who wish to return back to their rightful home after the war in Former Yugoslavia find their homes occupied by those they once fought with

fields.title: Croatia E(n)d-en on Earth
fields.abstract: 300 asylum-seeking refugees in Croatia struggle to get recognition, two years after the country signed an asylum law into power

fields.title: Libya: The Migrant Trap
fields.abstract: In the violent political vacuum of post-Ghaddafi Libya, refugees from all over the world face major human rights violations in refugee camps and on their journeys there

fields.title: Hopeless in Sweden
fields.abstract: Over 300 ethnically Hungarian migrants, mostly from Roma background, who want to seek asylum in Sweden

fields.title: Africa 11
fields.abstract: Asylum seeking refugees who seek integration in Austria through participating and pursuing a future within the game of soccer

fields.title: Island 36
fields.abstract: Refugees  in a German refugee camp focusing on advocating asylum law in order to receive better rights for refugees and migrants

fields.title: Waiting...
fields.abstract: Illegal refugees in France, who face violence and difficulties from immigration officials, are seeking to someday reach England to work and gain asylum

fields.title: Homeless Kids
fields.abstract: The narratives of children refugees who hope to someday go out beyond the walls of the refugee camp they're living in within Belgium

fields.title: Playground
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugee who is waiting to hear about his asylum status. Over the course of two years, he discusses his daily life, challenges, and fears are while living in France

fields.title: The Arrivals
fields.abstract: Discusses the struggles, fears, and constant waiting that refugee families go through during the asylum process in France, while also dealing with very overwhelmed and understaffed asylum offices

fields.title: Farid: In Zurich or Somewhere
fields.abstract: Rejected asylum-seeking refugees who face the ultimate fear and worry of a future deportation either back to their country of origin or a safe third country

fields.title: The Fortress
fields.abstract: A Swiss transit camp hosts over 200 asylum-seeking people who struggle with the inconsistent nature of the asylum application process by those running the camp

fields.title: Life in Paradise: Illegals in the Neighborhood
fields.abstract: In a remote European village, officials build a housing complex for rejected asylum-seekers and illegal immigrants, turning the small village into a microcosm of the broader world

fields.title: No Way Back
fields.abstract: Being an unaccompanied minor on a refugee trail is hard enough, it gets even worse when these children get stuck at sea for days trying to get to Australia

fields.title: Mimoune
fields.abstract: Shows the hardship of family division as an illegal refugee and the fight to reunify by one family

fields.title: Reaching Albion
fields.abstract: This short documentary features interviews with refugees stuck in Calais, France try to reach the United Kingdom

fields.title: Wanakam
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking Tamil refugees who are facing the rigorous asylum process within Switzerland struggle to get granted asylum and to get through the process

fields.title: Special Flight
fields.abstract: Rejected asylum seekers who are forcibly being removed from Switzerland on "Special Flights" which are known to be dehumanizing ways of exiting refugees back to their country of origin

fields.title: Nowhere in Europe: Escaping Chechnya for Europe
fields.abstract: Refugees and Asylum-seekers escaping the violence in Chechnya to head towards Western Europe face many unique difficulties that are portrayed in the film

fields.title: Fortress Europe
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees from: Chechnya, Russia, Bulgaria, Moldova, Kazakhstan, Iran, Philippines, China and Iraq who are looking for a better life in Europe

fields.title: Vakha and Magomed
fields.abstract: Two Chechen refugees, who have sought asylum in Warsaw, Poland, have developed a good relationship, which the film focuses on rather than focusing on their past

fields.title: Can't be Silent: On Tour with the Refugees
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees, also originating from The Gambia, Somalia, and Iran, who look to music and performance to freely express themselves when a majority of their liberties- particularly the freedom to move around freely throughout Germany, are restricted

fields.title: Hope
fields.abstract: A refugee who survives a boat sinking that killed over 400 other refugees, then spends the rest of her life telling her story

fields.title: A Nun's New Habit
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees from Iraq and Iran placed in detention centers in Australia face challenges and harassment within the refugee center and in society

fields.title: 300 Miles to Heaven
fields.abstract: In this accurate dramatization of a daring escape by two boys from communist Poland to Denmark, the boys soon learn the world outside communism can also be harsh and sometimes unforgiving

fields.title: Bosnia, Bosnia!
fields.abstract: Refugees who were rescued from a psychiatric ward in Bosnia during the war in Former Yugoslavia have been in a makeshift refugee camp for the past 17 years in Hungary

fields.title: Document: Hoyerswerda I Frontex
fields.abstract: The story of racial attacks on refugees that happened in Hoyerswerda (East Germany) on four people from Mozambique in 1991 and those who tried to help them, also showcases the difference between immigration policy then and now

fields.title: LogBook_Serbistan
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees who are seeking all opportunities to arrive in Europe and face major hardships and humiliations; the fiction film shadows the restrictive nature of Europe's immigration policies

fields.title: Caught Between Two Worlds
fields.abstract: Four people, from four different countries and cultures have the commonality of being refugees in Hungary stuck in a transition camp to prepare them for life in Hungary

fields.title: Children in Exile: Recollections of Childhood
fields.abstract: Under the Soviet government during World War II, there were many victims of atrocities committed by the government on its own people, this film focuses on just the youngest among those victims

fields.title: Saved By Words
fields.abstract: The story of a refugee escaping from Iraq and waiting to receive a residency permit and shows the hardship and challenges of being an immigrant refugee into Europe and leaving your family and identity behind

fields.title: Voices in Transit
fields.abstract: Identities can quickly change and become lost through the asylum-seeking process, particularly when certain countries aren't receptive to refugees at all

fields.title: The Immigration Judge
fields.abstract: From the perspective of immigration judges- shows their various, daily dilemmas while deciding the fates of immigrants and refugees within Amsterdam

fields.title: Houses
fields.abstract: The film showcases refugees from the former Yugoslavia and the struggles they face in a refugee camp in Hungary

fields.title: The Eye of the Needle
fields.abstract: Asylum-seeking refugees from Macedonia and Bosnia work to understand and follow the order of the Swedish and European migration policy.

fields.title: Those
fields.abstract: When a new refugee camp is opened a few miles away from a small Hungarian village, the villagers have mixed reactions, with some resorting to violence and protests

fields.title: The Unwanted
fields.abstract: The Bulgarian authorities forced the migration of 1 million ethnic Turks to Turkey if they refused to change their names into Bulgarian ones. Over 350,000 individuals fled the country and Turkey close their borders, leaving many people divided

fields.title: Between the Lines
fields.abstract: This film focuses on the detention and "illegal" status of immigrants specifically in New Delhi and the often harsh situations they faced away from their families

fields.title: Outside of Europe
fields.abstract: Because of the EU's often strict immigration/refugee policy, many trying to get in through Ukraine end up at two refugee centers on the Ukrainian side of the border, hoping to someday get into the EU

fields.title: Shafiq Monis in Australia
fields.abstract: Narrative of an Afghan man caught by the Taliban for drawing and painting, which is considered a crime under their command. He soon after fled the country and is detained in a refugee center in Australia

fields.title: Free Inside...Gypsies and Swiss
fields.abstract: Discusses internally-displaced Yenish people, a majority of which were young children, within Switzerland who were forced from their homes to participate in "re-education" programs
fields.notes: Donation from OSI-Budapest Arts and Culture Program
